title: Sechs Hölderlin-Fragmente
text:
Sechs Hölderlin-Fragmente (English: "Six Hölderlin Fragments") is a <a href="song%20cycle">song cycle</a> for high voice and piano composed in 1958 by <a href="Benjamin%20Britten">Benjamin Britten</a> (191376), and published as his <a href="Opus%20number">Op.</a> 61. It consists of settings of six short poems and verse fragments by the German lyric poet <a href="Friedrich%20H%C3%B6lderlin">Friedrich Hölderlin</a> (17701843).
Britten had been introduced to the poetry of Hölderlin by <a href="Louis%2C%20Prince%20of%20Hesse%20and%20by%20Rhine">Prince Ludwig of Hesse</a>, and the cycle is dedicated to him. It was recorded by <a href="Peter%20Pears">Peter Pears</a> (tenor) and the composer (piano) and broadcast by the <a href="BBC">BBC</a> in November 1958.
